intro: Armeria pubinervis subsp. orissonensis, commonly known as the Orisson's thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as coastal areas or mountain slopes. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense, compact clusters. This subspecies is distinguished by its hairy leaves and the presence of pubescence on the leaf veins, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
